text.section:
In this section, "transportation ticket policy" means a ticket policy of health insurance that:
has as its dominant feature the protection of the insured from a transportation hazard; and
is sold at transportation stations, ticket offices, or travel bureaus by:
vending machines;
employees of railroads, steam lines, airlines, or other organizations engaged in transporting individuals on common carriers;
individuals or employees of persons engaged in selling transportation on common carriers; or
other qualified agents.

A transportation ticket policy may not be issued or delivered in the State unless it conforms to the requirements and provisions of §§ 15-102, 15-201, 15-202, 15-203, 15-205, and 15-207 through 15-226 of this title, subject to § 15-202(c) of this title that relates to inapplicable or inconsistent provisions.
